Keyboard shortcuts for Microsoft Outlook

A visual cheat-sheet for the 210 keyboard shortcuts found in Microsoft Outlook

Original Reference Report Issue

Frequently used

Close

  • Esc

Go to Home tab

  • Alt
  • H

New message

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • M

Send

  • Alt
  • S

Insert file

  • Alt
  • N

New task

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • K

Delete

  • Delete

Search

  • Ctrl
  • E

Reply

  • Ctrl
  • R

Forward

  • Ctrl
  • F

Reply all

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • R

Copy

  • Ctrl
  • C

Send/Receive

  • Alt
  • S

Go to calendar

  • Ctrl
  • 2

Create appointment

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • A

Move to folder

  • Alt
  • H
  • M, V

Attachment Save As

  • Alt
  • J
  • A

Basic navigation

Switch to Mail view

  • Ctrl
  • 1

Switch to Calendar view

  • Ctrl
  • 2

Switch to Contacts view

  • Ctrl
  • 3

Switch to Tasks view

  • Ctrl
  • 4

Switch to Notes

  • Ctrl
  • 5

Switch to Folders list in the Folder pane

  • Ctrl
  • 6

Switch to Shortcuts

  • Ctrl
  • 7

Switch to next open message

  • Ctrl
  • .

Switch to previous open message

  • Ctrl
  • ,

Move between Folder/Outlook/Reading/To-Do

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • Tab

Move ar ound message header lines in the Folder pane

  • Ctrl
  • Tab

Move around within the Folder pane

  • Arrows

Go to a different folder

  • Ctrl
  • Y

Go to the Search box

  • Ctrl
  • E

In the Reading pane, go to the previous message

  • Alt
  • Up

In the Reading pane, page down through text

  • Space

In the Reading pane, page up through text

  • Shift
  • Space

Collapse or expand a group in the email message list

  • Left/Right

Go back to previous view in the main Outlook window

  • Alt
  • B/Left

Go forward to next view in the main Outlook window

  • Alt
  • Right

Select the InfoBar and, if available, show menu of commands

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • W

Search

Find a message or other item

  • Ctrl
  • E

Clear the search results

  • Esc

Expand the search to include all items in module you are in

  • Ctrl
  • Alt
  • A

Use Advanced Find

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • F

Create a Search folder

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • P

Search for text within an open item

  • F4

Find and replace text/symbols in Reading pane

  • Ctrl
  • H

Expand search to include items from the current folder

  • Ctrl
  • Alt
  • K

Expand search to include subfolders

  • Ctrl
  • Alt
  • Z

Flags

  • Ctrl
  • Shift
  • G

Color categories

  • Alt
  • D

  • (letter)

  • A
